title: conferred on us by section 66 of the Courts of Justice Act 1924; section 70 of
heading: 1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Circuit Court Rules (Order
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Circuit Court Rules (Order 

36) 2024, shall come into operation on the 29th day of March 2024. 

(2) These Rules shall be construed together with the Circuit Court Rules 

2001 to 2023. 

(3) The Circuit Court Rules 2001 to 2023 as amended by these Rules may 

be cited as the Circuit Court Rules 2001 to 2024.

title: conferred on us by section 66 of the Courts of Justice Act 1924; section 70 of
heading: 2. The Circuit Court Rules are amended by the substitution for rules 9 and
text_raw:
2. The Circuit Court Rules are amended by the substitution for rules 9 and 

10 of Order 36 of the following rules: 

“9. An execution order based on any decree of the Court or 
judgment in default of appearance or defence may be issued in the Office 
within six years from the date of such decree or judgment. After the 
expiration of six years from the date of such decree or judgment, an 
execution order may be issued with the leave of the Court. An application 
for such leave shall be made by motion on notice to the party sought to 
be made liable.
text_norm: 2 circuit court rule amended substitution rule 9 10 order 36 following rule 9 execution order based decree court judgment default appearance defence may issued office within six year date decree judgment expiration six year date decree judgment execution order may issued leave court application leave shall made motion notice party sought made liable

title: conferred on us by section 66 of the Courts of Justice Act 1924; section 70 of
heading: If, at any time after the making of a decree or judgment in
text_raw:
10. 

If, at any time after the making of a decree or judgment in 
default referred to in rule 9, any change has taken place, by death, 
assignment or otherwise, in the parties entitled or liable to execution, the 
party claiming to be so entitled may apply to the Court on notice for 
leave to issue execution, and the original decree or judgment may be 
amended so as to give effect to any order made by the Court on the 
application.” 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [107]

title: conferred on us by section 66 of the Courts of Justice Act 1924; section 70 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These rules amend Order 36 rules 9 and 10 of the Circuit Court Rules by 
removing a reference to decrees and judgments being in force for a period of 
twelve years.
